intro: Elaeoselinum gummiferum, commonly known as the gum plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, and its roots are known to exude a sticky, resinous gum. Elaeoselinum gummiferum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
